pr_pip

Class RightPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • pr_pip.RightPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class RightPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    It's a JPanel that has a JLabel on it. The JLabel is used to display the image. The JPanel is used to draw the rectangles
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • drawPerfectRect

        public void drawPerfectRect(java.awt.Graphics g,
                            int x,
                            int y,
                            int x2,
                            int y2)
        Draw a rectangle with the top left corner at (px,py) and the bottom right corner at (px+pw,py+ph).
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to draw on.
        x - The x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle to be drawn.
        y - The y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle to be drawn.
        x2 - The x coordinate of the second point.
        y2 - The y coordinate of the second point.

      • getUserChoice

        public void getUserChoice(DrawButton btn)
        This function is called when the user clicks on a button. It sets the userChoice variable to the button that was clicked
        Parameters:
        btn - The button that the user will click to select their choice.
